questions.question: Can approach and avoid conspecifics or other species in the enclosure?
Performs appropriate levels of self-care behaviours (e.g. grooming, feeding, drinking, resting, comfort activities)?
Has mostly positive, non-harmful interactions and relationships with conspecifics or other animals?
Has mostly positive or neutral interactions and relationships with staff?
Has mostly neutral or positive experiences of visitors (i.e. non-aggressive/fearful/aversive)?
Responds appropriately to novel changes in the environment (e.g. enrichment) with interest rather than aversion and fear?
Can express choice and control over being in indoor/outdoor areas of enclosure, except for enclosure cleaning, maintenance, and feeding?
Can patrol/maintain territory in the enclosure, as appropriate?
Can perform appropriate foraging (searching for food) and feeding (consuming food) behaviours?
Can play, alone or socially?
Can achieve appropriate levels and patterns of rest and sleep?
Can experience tactile pleasures such as social grooming, scratching on substrates?
Can express motivated courtship and mating behaviours?
Can express species-specific ‘behavioural needs’ such as rooting, nest-building?
Does not perform abnormal (e.g. self-injurious, stereotypic) behaviours?
If abnormal behaviours are known, are measures in place to understand the causes of this behaviour and if/how it may be reduced or eliminated?

questions.section: 1B: Physical Health - Animal-Based Indicators of Welfare

questions.question: Appears to be in good physical condition (e.g. no abnormal discharge; good condition of pelage, plumage, skin, scale, scute, teeth, horn)?
Has no signs of pain and/or suffering (e.g. wincing, flinching, lameness)?
Has a ‘body condition score’ and/or body mass within normal limits?
Has good muscle definition and tone?
Has appropriately formed faeces?
Has no signs of debility/weakness?
Has no known recurring acute disease or injury?
Has no known chronic disease or injury?
Has a routine health check at appropriate intervals?
Has parasitology screening and treatments at appropriate intervals?
Can drink from water on demand?
Can drink from a clean, fresh water source?
Can consume an appropriate quantity of food?
Can consume a high-quality, nutritious diet?
Can consume an appropriately presented diet (consider timing, format, position in enclosure, social interactions)?
Has an appropriate temperature level, which may include a temperature gradient or access to shaded and heated areas?
Has an appropriate humidity level, which may include a humidity gradient?
Has high air quality, free of pollutants, heavy dust and aversive odours, and is well-ventilated?
Has appropriate lighting frequency/colour/brightness, without flicker or glare?
Has an appropriate photoperiod (light-dark cycle)?
Has appropriate sound pressure (audible noise, vibration) levels?
Has adequate size, shape and topography for animal exercise and territory exploration?
Has appropriate substrate for locomotion (abrasion, traction, support)?
Has appropriate shelters, retreats, off-show/out-of-sight areas away from visitors and conspecifics?
Has a structure which is safe and secure with no or mitigated risk of harm (e.g. fences and barriers)?
